# The `Intrinsic` Namespace Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This namespace contains an enum with a value for every intrinsic/builtin function known by LLVM. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Definition

<CodeBlock>namespace llvm::Intrinsic &#123; ... &#125;</CodeBlock>

<MembersIndex>

  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/intrinsic/iitdescriptor">IITDescriptor</a></>}>
This is a type descriptor which explains the type requirements of an intrinsic. <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/intrinsic/iitdescriptor/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

## Description {#details}

This namespace contains an enum with a value for every intrinsic/builtin function known by LLVM.

The enum values are returned by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function/#a4d0a7baab8d078065b2de10e3460892a">Function::getIntrinsicID()</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### getIntrinsicSignature() {#adce8df27d44de3e02c13209348660f0e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::Intrinsic::getIntrinsicSignature (<a href="#a80add6b3b1cdaec560907995127adc16">Intrinsic::ID</a> ID, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functiontype">FunctionType</a> &#42; FT, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; ArgTys)</>}>
Gets the type arguments of an intrinsic call by matching type contraints specified by the .td file.

The overloaded types are pushed into the AgTys vector.

Returns false if the given <a href="#a80add6b3b1cdaec560907995127adc16">ID</a> and function type combination is not a valid intrinsic call.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsics-h/#l00257">257</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsics-h">Intrinsics.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/intrinsics-cpp/#l01060">1060</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/intrinsics-cpp">Intrinsics.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getIntrinsicSignature() {#a720100fe2ad7a57ecd75a4f80f8b766c}

### getName() {#a7157f9fa9dd11f234ec3c58517cb6d96}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>StringRef llvm::Intrinsic::getName (<a href="#a80add6b3b1cdaec560907995127adc16">ID</a> id)</>}>
Return the LLVM name for an intrinsic, such as &quot;llvm.ppc.altivec.lvx&quot;.

Note, this version is for intrinsics with no overloads. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> the other version of getName if overloads are required.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsics-h/#l00055">55</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsics-h">Intrinsics.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/intrinsics-cpp/#l00047">47</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/intrinsics-cpp">Intrinsics.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getName() {#a9a6d8be4a3793bd5cef4d3f25508a4fa}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::string llvm::Intrinsic::getName (<a href="#a80add6b3b1cdaec560907995127adc16">ID</a> Id, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; &gt; Tys, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &#42; M, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functiontype">FunctionType</a> &#42; FT=nullptr)</>}>
Return the LLVM name for an intrinsic, such as &quot;llvm.ppc.altivec.lvx&quot; or &quot;llvm.ssa.copy.p0s&#95;s.1&quot;.

Note, this version of getName supports overloads. This is less efficient than the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> version of this function. If no overloads are required, it is safe to use this version, but better to use the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> version. If one of the types is based on an unnamed type, a function type will be computed. Providing FT will avoid this computation.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsics-h/#l00067">67</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsics-h">Intrinsics.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/intrinsics-cpp/#l00179">179</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/intrinsics-cpp">Intrinsics.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition

Return the LLVM name for an intrinsic.

This is a special version only to be used by LLVMIntrinsicCopyOverloadedName. It only supports overloads based on named types.

### getOrInsertDeclaration() {#a0cff8be0190d8e20b7cf13646f34afa2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Function &#42; llvm::Intrinsic::getOrInsertDeclaration (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &#42; M, <a href="#a80add6b3b1cdaec560907995127adc16">ID</a> id, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; &gt; Tys=&#123;&#125;)</>}>
Look up the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> declaration of the intrinsic <code>id</code> in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> <code>M</code>.

If it does not exist, add a declaration and return it. Otherwise, return the existing declaration.

The <code>Tys</code> parameter is for intrinsics with overloaded types (e.g., those using iAny, fAny, vAny, or pAny). For a declaration of an overloaded intrinsic, Tys must provide exactly one type for each overloaded type in the intrinsic.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsics-h/#l00098">98</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/intrinsics-h">Intrinsics.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/intrinsics-cpp/#l00732">732</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/intrinsics-cpp">Intrinsics.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### matchIntrinsicSignature() {#a17dfad57f1487bb34ef68784a2e878c8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Intrinsic::MatchIntrinsicTypesResult llvm::Intrinsic::matchIntrinsicSignature (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functiontype">FunctionType</a> &#42; FTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/intrinsic/iitdescriptor">IITDescriptor</a> &gt; &amp; Infos, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; ArgTys)</>}>
Match the specified function type with the type constraints specified by the .td file.

If the given type is an overloaded type it is pushed to the ArgTys vector.

Returns false if the given type matches with the constraints, true otherwise.
